Salary progression beyond this scale is subject to performance.The School of Psychology, University of Nottingham, is seeking to appoint a Research Assistant to assist Professor Stephen Jackson and colleagues with an NIHR-funded research programme being conducted within the Nottingham Biomedical Research Centre.  The position is available until 30th November 2022 and will involve a range of duties, including but not limited to: assisting with participant recruitment; assessment of research participants using standard assessments (training will be given where needed); assisting with experimental studies using brain stimulation and/or brain imaging techniques (training and supervision would be provided where necessary); and data analysis. This post would suit an individual with a first degree in Psychology or preferably a masters degree in Psychology or a closely related subject.Hours of work are full time (36.25 hours). Job share arrangements maybe considered.Informal enquiries may be addressed to Stephen.jackson@nottingham.ac.uk.
